TensorClient¶

Constructor¶

TensorClient(base_map, synchronizer, **kwargs)

The client was designed to handle multiple tensors data in a simpler way using Xarray in the background, it can support the same files than Xarray but those formats needs to be implemented using the BaseStorage interface proposed in this package.

Tensor Definition Methods¶

TensorClient.create_tensor(path, definition)

Create the path and the first file of the tensor which store the necessary metadata to use it, this method must always be called before start to write in the tensor.

TensorClient.get_tensor_definition(path)

Retrieve the tensor definition of an specific tensor.

Storage Methods¶

TensorClient.storage_method_caller(path, …)

Calls an specific method of a Storage, this include send the parameters specified in the tensor_definition or modifying the behaviour of the method based in your tensor_definition (read TensorClient.add_definition() for more info of how to personalize your method).

TensorClient.read(path, **kwargs)

Calls TensorClient.storage_method_caller() with read as method_name (has the same parameters).

TensorClient.store(path, **kwargs)

Calls TensorClient.storage_method_caller() with store as method_name (has the same parameters).

TensorClient.append(path, **kwargs)

Calls TensorClient.storage_method_caller() with append as method_name (has the same parameters).

TensorClient.update(path, **kwargs)

Calls TensorClient.storage_method_caller() with update as method_name (has the same parameters).

TensorClient.upsert(path, **kwargs)

Calls TensorClient.storage_method_caller() with upsert as method_name (has the same parameters).

TensorClient.delete_tensor(path[, only_data])

Delete the tensor

TensorClient.exist(path, **kwargs)

Calls TensorClient.storage_method_caller() with exist as method_name (has the same parameters).

TensorClient.get_cached_storage(path, …)

Create a CachedStorage object which is used for multiples writes of the same file.

TensorClient.apply_data_transformation(…)

TensorClient.get_storage(path[, definition])

Get the storage of the tensor, by default it try to read the stored definition of the tensor.

Tensor Calculation Methods¶

TensorClient.read_from_formula(formula[, …])

This is one of the most important methods of the TensorClient class, basically it allows to define formulas that use the tensors stored with a simple strings, so you can create new tensors from this formulas (make use of python eval and the same syntax that you use with Xarray).

TensorClient.ffill(new_data, dim[, limit, …])

TensorClient.rank(new_data, dim[, method, …])
